snippet: Several conservative figures who stood by the police in Ferguson, Mo., condemned them on Staten Island.
abstract: Some Republican political figures and conservative commentators who supported police in Ferguson, Mo, are condemning them on Staten Island in chokehold death of black man Eric Garner; many Democrats and Republicans alike see incident as clear case of police abuse, even though grand jury chose not to indict white police offer in death.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and AMY CHOZICK
byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro contributed reporting from Calgary, Alberta.

lead_paragraph: Several conservative figures who stood by the police in Ferguson, Mo., condemned them on Staten Island.

headline.main: Some Conservatives Say Deadly Force Used to Subdue Garner Didn’t Fit the Crime
headline.print_headline: Some Conservatives Say Deadly Force Used to Subdue Garner Didn’t Fit Crime
